data.title: Doclike Doc or Lifelike Doc Performativi
data.meta_description: Doclike Doc or Lifelike Doc Performativi - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. This document provides an analysis of the film Double Blind by Sophie Calle. It discusses how the film blurs the lines between documentary and life by having the filmmakers (Calle and Greg Shephard) serve as both directors and characters on a road trip. The film alternates footage from their individual camcorders to document personal diaries and their relationship developing along the way. This challenges the notion that documentaries need to be purely referential by making the documenting process itself performative and fluid, mirroring the ephemeral nature of life. The essay explores how the film's use of intimate, home video-style aesthetics allows viewers to engage with the characters on a personal level and see through their eyes rather than just observing
